quotes.text: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Do not disturb yourself by thinking of the whole of your life. Let not your thoughts at once embrace all the various troubles which you may expect to befall you.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Confine yourself to the present.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: How much more grievous are the consequences of anger than the causes of it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: If it is not right do not do it; if it is not true do not say it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: Any person capable of angering you becomes your master.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: Circumstances don't make the man, they only reveal him to himself.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: Seek not the good in external things; seek it in yourselves.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: How does it help to make troubles heavier by bemoaning them?
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: No person has the power to have everything they want, but it is in their power not to want what they don't have.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Life is long if you know how to use it.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms - you'll be able to use them better when you're older.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: What need is there to weep over parts of life? The whole of it calls for tears.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: While we wait for life, life passes.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Withdraw into yourself, as far as you can. Associate with those who will make a better man of you.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Every new beginning comes from some other beginning's end.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Expect from others what you have done to others: that is the just rule.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: In the morning when you rise unwillingly, let this thought be present: I am rising to the work of a human being.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Remind yourself that the man who lives longest and the man who will die soonest lose just the same thing.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Let your sleep be like the closing of a chapter: finished and ready for the next.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Give yourself a gift: the present moment.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: To be calm is the highest achievement of the self.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: The tranquility that comes when you stop caring what they say, or think, or do. Only what you do.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: He who is brave is free.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: The wise man looks into space and does not regard the small as too little, nor the great as too big.
quotes.author: Epictetus
